155331.content:
Ilyana ducked her head back behind the bush that seperated her from the patroling guards beyond. The recent months had been hard on the young mage, as one could tell by how filthy her outfit had become and how her once bright blue hair had been drowned out by splotches of brown and green. As the war against the forces of the godess Ashera had finally been brought to a close with her defeat at the Tower of Guidance, the soldiers returned to the fields and a massive reconstruction effort had begun. Since trade caravans were in such high demand as overland transports, a wealthy Baron in Begnion had bought out the caravan that she had relied upon as her primary source of food for a while now; and, being the ruthless cost-cutter that he was, had kicked the freeloading mage out of the wagon train. Now alone, Ilyana had been forcing herself to try and work up the courage to ask random strangers either for a job or a small handout, and since niether of those options provided her with the unprecedented ammount of food she required to ease her hunger pains, the mage had recently taken up stealing her breakfast. And her other breakfast. And her pre-lunch. And her post-lunch...

A sharp pain shot through her midesection, reminding Ilyana that she hadn't eaten anything for atleast five hours. Five hours! That was an ungodly long time for the poor mage, and the reason why she was currently trying to infiltrate this military base she had spotted a few hundred feet from the coastline. Although judging from the dark gray armor the passing soldiers wore, they weren't apart of any army she had seen before. No matter, soldiers required food; and Ilyana needed that food even more than they did.

As soon as the latern light carried by a trio of soldiers passed suffeciently far enough and had once again left her alone in the darkness, the thunder mage made a break for the wooden palistide infront of her. After a few frantic moments of searching, she managed to find a gap in the hastily constructed wall that was wide enough for her to shove her tiny frame through. It took some effort, but Ilyana managed to push her way past the constricting logs before anyone took notice, before creeping over to the nearest building and pushing her back against the wall. She really hadn't gotten a really good picture of what the layout of the base looked like- in fact, she hadn't given this little mission of hers much thought at all; somehow believing that the food would just fall into her lap if she made it this far. No such luck as it turned out, forcing the blue-haired mage to try and figure everything out on the go as she crept past a series of sentries while making her way towards the opposite side of the base.

That's when the smell hit her. Bread. Ilyana shivered slightly with excitement as her nose directed her onwards towards a small, one room building where two escorted men were storing bags of freshly made rolls. Just as she made her approach, one of the men started to speak, causing her to slam herself against the nearest wall in terror.

"You hear something?" One of the unloaders mentioned to the group.

"Nothing," one of the escorting soldiers said with a nod, before slaming the door closed as the last bag was placed inside the storeroom.

"There. That should be enough to last us a week or two. Atleast until the next shipment comes in."

"I'm sure commander Vivian would be pleased to here that." One of the other soldiers said with a nod as the group began to disperse.

Ilyana remained standing stock still until the sound of metal boots clanking against the ground beneath faded off into the distance. Taking a moment to calm herself down, the mage poked her head around the wall to notice that the storeroom was no completely unguarded.

"Oh, what luck!" llyana cheered in her head. Feeling all fear of being caught melt away by her wonderous good fortune, Ilyana practically sprinted over to the storeroom and quickly made her way in.

Ilyana couldn't believe her eyes. There was easily enough bags and boxes of foodstuffs in here to field a force five times as big as the one Ilyana had roughly guessed was stationed here. She was practically overwhelmed by the shear volume of food that she didn't no where to begin. Instinct took over quickly, however, and the young mage found herself reaching into the nearest bag and shoving whatever it was into her mouth without even noticing what had been in her hand. As soon as the balled up dough made contact with her tongue, all abstract thought the mage entertained was immediately quashed by a tidal wave of desire. She needed to have more. More to quell the horrible pain that wracked her midsection. And more to insure that it didn't return for as long as possible.

The first roll was immediately followed by another, and another, until the blue-haired mage had emptied the sizeable bag. Despite this, the pain still persisted, driving her to begin grabbing chunks of salted meat from a nearby barrel and shoving said chunks down her throat. After the first pound or so of meat that the ravenous mage had consumed, it suddenly dawned upon her that salted meat made one rather thirsty. Breaking herself away from her feast, Ilyana loked around the storeroom for any sort of drink. As luck would have it, against the opposite wall was a keg of some sort of liquor; fixed with a convienient spout. Normally, Ilyana wasn't a big fan of alcohol, but she really needed somthing to wet her mouth enough to continue eating, so she walked over to the barrel and formed a cup with one of her hands as she turned the spout with the other. Almost instantly, a small stream of strong smelling liquid began to flow, easily overflowing the boundries formed by the mage's small hands in a matter of moments. Slightly panicing over the mess she was making, Ilyana quickly brought the handful of booze up to her lips as she tried to flip the spout off with her free hand. Her grip slipped, forcing her to try and pool more and more of the liquor in her hands to avoid it spilling everywhere. After two or three more handfuls than she had probably intended to drink, she managed to clumsily shut the valve off.

"... I really hope no one notices..." Ilyana thought nervously to herself as she returned to the plethora of food infront of her. Opting to try to find something other than meat, the thunder mage pulled a small wodden box open to find a selection of candied fruit. After wolfing the sugary morsels down by the handful, and proceeding to do the same with the contents of two or three similar containers, Ilyana noticed that her vision was starting to blur.

"Oh... guess I drank too much..." The blue-haired mage thought through a minor headache that was forming. "I should sit down and rest my eyes for a moment..."
155331.title: Sneaky Mage?

choices: She meets the chef and tells him exactly what she wants, but his food is odd
She is still tired. nothing but bedrest and food for now
1553312.content:
"I hope you don't mind that I set you at the dinner table, but I thought that you would be hungry." said a familiar voice. Illyana had trouble placing it at first, but then a moment later she recognized the silver haired Trueblade across the table from her.

"Sir Zihark! You brought me food!" she gushed in excitement as she noticed a feast fit for a king before her. Immediately she tore into the meat and bread and stuffed it down her gullet. Zihark laughed a bit, when a second voice spoke up.

"Hey, I'm here too you know." said a blonde rogue. Still devouring food at a rate that would put Ike and many laguz to shame Ilyana saw Heather.

"Heaver, wut ur you an' shir shiharg doing ere?" the blue haired spellcaster asked with a full mouth.

"Well we were recruited by Begnion to watch over this group of mercenaries and make sure that they protect a few nearby villages.Their army was spread thin and they needed to recruit outside help. They picked me because...Well you know I have a way with people. Even though I told them I wouldn't be cheap." Heather explained. "Zihark was asked because of his ability to negotiate with laguz. They also needed a figure head that wasn't too pricey, but could keep folks in line."

"Well put." Zihark said smirking. "I was glad to be able to see a familiar female face, but now we have two."

Heather nodded gazing at Ilyana. "Yes, and a beautiful one at that. So can you tell us how you came here?"

"Well it's not a very good tale. Just thinking about it makes me even hungrier...." Ilyana said looking at the now emptied table. Only bones on a few plates showed that anything was ever there.

"We'll get you more. As high ranking members of this outfit we get whatever we require. We'll get you some food and you can tell us." the blonde went on.

So after several servings of food that would feed a normal person for a week Illyana finished her woeful tale of starvation, loneliness, and general misfortune.

"...And one time I had to go for a whole 12 hours without food...I was very lucky there was an apple tree or else I would've died."

"Poor Ilyana. Well we'll make sure you're cared for consistently. We could always use another person in charge."

"So you mean I'll get food, pay, and whatever I need from the people working here?"

"Of course." Zihark said, "I know you can handle it."

"Oh thank you both." she said hgging them both. Surprisingly her stomach had a rounded shape. Beore no matter how much Ilyana ate she remained svelte, but this was a first that went unnoticed.

After the meal Ilyana was showed to a room and was to be given new clothes in the morning.

The next day...

15533122.content:
Sunlight fell through a nearby window onto Ilyana's pale face, causing her to stir and awake with a yawn. It had certainly been awhile since she had slept in a good-quality bed; and this one was particulary plush and comfortable. So much so that not even her usual need for a late night meal or two had been strong enough to wake the blue-haired mage from her perfect slumber.

Of course, now that it was morning however...

"F-food..." Ilyana said with a pained grown as she pulled herself upright into a seeting position. At the foot of her bed, someone had been generous enough to leave a tray (although to be honest, it was atleast the size of three normal trays) with her breakfast on it. The metal slab was absolutely submerged beneath plate after plate of fruit tarts, fresh apples, cakes, sausages, and two huge pitchers of milk with a matching glass. Infront of it all was a little handwritten note, which Ilyana quickly grabbed between her tiny hands and began reading.

---------------------------------
Ilyana,

I had breakfast prepared for you this morning, Sweety. I convinced Zihark to cut you a little slack on your first day to help you recover from the horrendous ordeal that you've been through in the past months. If you need anything, feel free to ask the soldier that's been assigned to be your guide, his name is Cyrus. Or, if you're feeling a little shy, you can always come find me in the quartermaster's office, and I'll make sure you get everything you want.

With love,

Heather.

-------------------------------

"Oh, hank ou Heaver!" Ilyana said to herself as she sprayed a dusting of sugar all over the bed; apparently she had started eating before her eyes had processed the entirety of the message. Casting the paper aside in order to free up both hands, the thunder mage began shoving as much as she could possibly fit into her mouth at once. Starting with the assorted pastries, Ilyana would grasp ahold of two or three at a time and start chewing on them all at once. Their various sugars, juices, and jams would all run together in the mage's mouth, to the point that she couldn't tell where one pastry's contents ended and where another's began. Once the concoctions of sweet sugar and glaze had been consumed, Ilyana poored herself a glass of milk with one hand while attempting to take a bite out of an apple at the same time. Since this only resulted in a slight spillage, the mage opted to place the apple down long enough for her to fill her glass all the way before attempting to shove the entire red-fruit into her mouth at once. Draining her first glass in only moments, Ilyana returned her attention to the fruit she had stumbled on earlier and proceeded to eat it whole; core and all. The first apple was quickly followed by a second and third, until only the plates of finely roasted sausages stood before the insatiable spellcaster. Like all of the plates of assorted foodstuffs before it, the suasages stood no chance against Ilyana's hunger, and were one by one transfered into the mage's taut belly.

"Ah, that feels so much better," Ilyana said with a moan of delight as her now engorged stomach proved to be enough to cause her hunger pains to subside. She leaned back into the soft cushions beneath her, once again feeling her still realitively slim body become emmersed in comfort.

Suddenly, there was a knock at the door, which caused the bloated spellcaster's body to jump upright in fright. Instinctively, Ilyana reached for her trusty Elthunder spellbook- only to remember that she had pawned it off in a town a few days ago so she could afford to purchase all these aboslutely wonderful looking pies a merchant had been selling. They really seemed worth it at the time, but now...

"Ehem- uh, Lady Ilyana, are you awake?" An unrecognisable voice said from behind the wooden barrier.

"W-who is it?" Ilyana sheepishly replied.

"It's Cyrus. Lady Heather had me stationed to be your aide for the day. If you'll allow me to enter, I have an outfit that she sent for you to wear today. She said your old one was... 'unsutiably dirty for one such as yourself'"

With that said, Cyrus entered into the room, bearing a silver robe that was far to formal to be wearing while staffing a mercenary encampment. Not that Cyrus had argued the point too strongly after some... insistence on the rogue's part. Judging by the style of half-plate armor and the curved helmet he wore that came down to conceal his eyes, it seemed to Ilyana that Cyrus must have been an offical soldier in the service of one of Tellius' many lords and ladies and one point in his life. Why he had decided to switch to mercenary work was a question that the thunder mage felt too shy to bother him about.

"Oh, t-thank you," Ilyana said as she brushed the mess of meat, fruit, and sugar off her face and took the robe from the appointed aid. While the robe was indeed nice, it proved to be a few inches too long for the rather small spellcaster, and came with an unexpected tightness around her midsection. Still though, since her normal outfit had been disposed of, this would have to do till she had time to ask Heather to order something else for you to where.

"Is there anything else you require, Lady Ilyana?"

"Well, now that you mention it..."

--------------------------

A large black bird soared over the makeshift battlements in the dead of night, it's powerful wings extinguishing a few nearby torches with the gusts they caused. After circling above the camp a few times, the enormous bird came to land at the back entrance to the living quarters of the mercenary commander, Vivian. With a low pitched squak, the bird's talons suddenly extened downwards towards the ground and formed legs. It's beak suddely dulled and rounded, and it's eyes began to take on the appearence of a man's. Once the transformation was complete, the crow laguz quickly flattened his wings to his back and made his way through the door.

"Ah, Koza, your early for once," A stern voice met the raven at the door, originating from a pale, dark haired woman wearing enough armor to crush a horse, who was currently flipping a gold coin between her fingures.

"Well, I couldn't possibly keep my meal ticket waiting," The laguz said as he settled himself down in a chair opposite from the knight's desk.

"I don't care for your reasons, just give your report."

"Alright, alright. Yeesh. Haven't you ever heard of making conversation with someone? Anyway, in the capital, it's pretty clear now that the public isn't going to be electing any of the aggresive types to the senate for the next century atleast thanks to their little mishap a few months ago. That should buy you some time for your little move in opperation. As for your little boat party that's heading our way from the east, I can assure you that your side as paid the fee most genorously, and has a guaranteed escort of our finest corsairs. They should be landing at the nearby coastline in a week or so."

"Excellent," Vivan said as a smile broke across her face, who then proceeded to toss the nearby bag of money at the crow laguz. "Keep up the good work and I assure you the empire will reward you most handsomely."

"I'm lookin' forward to it. You just keep sending this stuff my way, and we'll be goin' places."

"I'm sure we will. Dismissed."

"Alright, fine. I'm leavin'..."

After a big meal Vivian gives Ilyana an elixer to help stop her hunger
155331221.content:
Much later around lunchtime Ilyana, Heather, and Zihark had met in a private area to talk about business.

"While you're with us Ilyana, we need you to remember you're an officer here and that you have duty as one." Zihark said, "I still don't want you to strain yourself, but when it comes the time I want you to be up to speed on events so I'm going to introduce you to another person in charge that Heather and I have been working with."

"Who is he?" Ilyana asked as she crammed a slice of pie she had gotten before they had been seated. Because of her insatiable appetite the mage had another oversized tray which she ate from liberally. A few men watched in awe as she ate raw amounts of food that would put many Laguz or even the legendary Ike to shame. Heather spoke up after handing the lavendar haired woman a boiled potato that nearly fell off her tray.

"She. And her name is Vivian. She's a cute one, but so anti-social and gruff. I prefer company like Zihark or even that Gatrie person over women like her."

"Yes, but she is our partner for now, we'll just have to tough it out."

"Naturally, but if she says one bad thing about Ilyana..."

"If who says a bad thing about who else?" asked the serious voice of the mercenary commander. Looking behind herself Ilyana saw the beautiful yet imposing figure of Vivian. For a moment their eyes met, the mysterious woman saw the mage's food stained face and looked at her with minor disgust.She tore her eyes away when the blonde Rogue captured her attention.

"If you say a negative thing about Ilyana, our old friend from when we worked with Ike."

"Oh, Greil's boy." Vivian sighed rolling her eyes. "quite frankly I'm tired of hearing about him, but I suppose you'll be telling us another story about how great he was."

"No, we're just here to introduce her and talk about any business that needs to be taken care of." the silver haired man replied before looking at Ilyana gently, her cue to talk. Gulping down her mouthful of food and feeling her new dress become a bit tighter she smiled.

"A pleasure to meet you Vivian."

"Likewise. Now then let's talk business..."
155331221.title: Ilyana, Heather, Zihark, and Vivan have lunch t...

choices: Later that night, Vivian attepts to make conversation with Ilyana.
Or, prehaps speaking with either Heather or Zihark would be more benificial.
1553312211.content:
"I just recieved a request for aid from a village located a few miles to the north of here. Uncharacteristically for the region we're in, the town -which is known as Grey Haven by the way,- has a rather high population of L-" here Vivian paused for a moment, apparently unable to find the right word. "-Laguz, which is constantly harrassed even when the nation's army isn't spread so thin. Now that Begnion has a staffing problem, the inhabitants of the village are being attacked by slavers-"

"That's horrible!" Illyana blurted out, causing bits of sugary mush to crash into the granite surface in front of her.

"Do. Not. Interrupt." The commander said coldly as she glared at the offending thunder mage.

Ilyana stiffled a wimper and subconciously scooter her chair closer to Zihark's.

"That was completely uncalled for!" Heather yelled as she bolted up from her chair. "She clearly meant no offense, you didn't need to bite her head off like that! Didn't anyone teach you how to properly talk to others?"

"Heather..." Zihark muttered to himself as he placed his hand over his face. While it was true that the Knight's response was rude, the Theif wasn't exactly helping with the situation either.

"Quartermaster, your objection to my conversational skills has been noted; however, the more time we spend arguing, the more time the slavers have to get away, so i suggest we stop this pointless chatter and get down to dealing with the situation."

The blonde cutpurse scowled at the armored woman across the table from her, but said no more and returned to her seat.

"The commander is right," Zihark said as diplomatically as possible. "We need to be worried about the townspeople. Now then, what would be the best way to deploy our men..."

-----------------------------------

"Are you sure you're okay with me riding your horse?" Ilyana asked.

"Of course dear, don't worry about it," Heather responded softly as she gazed up at the thunder mage's somewhat awkward riding position. "Now, could you move forward a bit?"

The Theif took a few steps back, then nimbly jumped and landed cleanly in the remaining saddle space behind Ilyana. She then wrapped her hands around Ilyana's surprisingly soft middle and rested her face in the mage's lavender hair.

"Mmm," Heather purred. "Well, I'm ready to head out."

Vivan rolled her eyes at the scene that had just occured, and ordered her asembled men to begin the trek north.

"I don't understand it," The commander mused as she watched Heather reach into an overstuffed saddlebag and hand snack after snack to Ilyana as their journey progressed. "That Ilyana girl is undisciplined, and so frail and soft looking; she is clearly not a warrior. Not only that, but she also insists on eating enough food to feed a platoon of soldiers each day- and I'm starting to believe that she's the reason my dinner disapeared last night. No soldier in the empire would tolerate such an unhelpful resource sink- and yet the representitives Begnion attached to our camp are practically catering to her every whim; especially the Quartermaster. It makes no sense... unless-"

Vivian's normally stone-faced demeanour cracked just enough for a quick smile to form on her face.

"No, that's rediculous. There's no way that she could be some sort of noble- No," The commander's trademark frown returned again. "I shouldn't discount such things based on appearence when there's evidence to support it. I hadn't expected to run into any of this nation's nobles before the rest of the army arrived, but winning the support of a local aristocrat would greatly ease our attempts to get a foothold on this continent."

"Commander," a Soldier approached Vivian's horse and saluted. "We're approaching the outskirts of the village, and our scouts have reported signs of an ongoing conflict within."

"I see," Vivian said with a nod as she dismounted her horse and took hold of a spear and a tower shield handed to her by an aide. "You all have your orders, the slavers are to be slain at the slightest display of resistance. Form up, and move out."

A dozen soldiers moved in behind the Knight and brought their spears and bucklers to bare and began advancing towards the main entrance of the town. Behind the wall of spears, a half dozen or so archers drew an arrow from their quivers and matched pace with the soldiers.

"Um, where do I stand?" Ilyana asked as Heather helped her down from the saddle.

"Nowhere. We're Irregulars, we basically go in on our own and help Vivian's group the best way that we see fit." Zihark said reasuringly as he drew his trusty silver sword.

"Just be sure to stick close to us, and I'll make sure that you stay safe." Heather said with a smile.

-------------------------------

A female cat Laguz was smacked over the top of the head with the blunt side of an ax, and collapsed to the dusty cobblestones that made up the floor of the town square. She was then quickly given a set of cuffs around her hands and feet and thrown into a makeshift holding pen with thirty or so other Laguz of various species, ages, and genders.

"Hahahahahaha!" A brown-haired man clad in a fighter's uniform laughed boisterously as he turned to face his fellow slavers. "Men, I believe that what we've got here, is a haul!"

The rest of the slavers, a motley collection of fighters, pirates, and myrmidons joined in their boss' good mood and laughed along with him.

"Yessir," the boss said as he wiped his ax on his boot. "Chasing after heron Laguz is a fool's game- Quanity over quality I say! A few more catches like this delivered straight to the capital, and our grandchildren will be able to retire!"

An arrow struck the ground a few inches away from the boss' boots, completely ruining the good mood the slavers were in.

"Halt," an almost monotonous tone flew through the air. "Drop all of your weapons and surrender immediately."

All at once, the slaver band turned towards the entrance to town, and caught sight of the armored woman who had just adressed them flanked by a squad or two of soldiers.

"Oh, the army's here, what a buzzkill." The boss said as he pulled out a rather large bag of coins. "Look, I know you're all professionals, but i still have more guys then you do, girly, and I'd really hate to have our catch ruined by a gigantic fight, so why don't you accept this parting gift and report to your superior that you arrived too late?"

The boss tossed the bulging bag to a swordsman, who walked out towards Vivian and offered the coinpurse to the Knight.

"No."

Within the blink of an eye, Vivian had impaled the hapless myrmidon with her spear, before casually tossing the blood-spouting body aside.

"how rude," The boss muttered, before both commanders led a charge against the opposing force.

Arrows flew. Spears stabbed. Swords slashed. Shields clashed. Axes smashed. Within minutes, however, the leader of the slaver band realized that his significantly larger force was no match for the much better equipped and trained enemies; and if he didn't act soon, then all could be lost.

"Fraking army," The boss cursed. "Well, there's nothing else we can do, time to cut our losses and run. Rolf, give the signal for everyone to split up, there's no way that bitch can chase down all of us-"

The fighter heard a body hit the ground. Turning around, he saw the face of the very man he had adressed split open by a throwing knife.

"Oh, did I do that?" A blond woman said as she emerged from behind an alleyway. "Sorry, that was meant for you."

"Dammit, more of them," The boss signaled to a personal cadre of guards. "Gut her,"

The guards rushed towards the Thief, only to find their weapons intercepted by a silver sword.

"Back off," The Trueblade glared at the slavers, who staggered back at the sight of the man's skills.

"There's just two of them!" The boss was losing his cool now as he called on the last of his reserves and lead a despreate charge to freedom.

The mauraders clashed with the two mercenaries, tying them up long enough for the boss to skirt around them.

"Hah, made it past them, now there's nothing that can stop my esca-" The fighter's words died in his mouth as he caught sight of a lavender haired girl sort of hiding a ways behind the other two. "Oh, come on! What's a guy gotta do to- wait, she's unarmed! this'll be easy!"

The boss drew his ax and sprinted towards the panicking girl.

"Oh, what do I do? I don't have my tome," Ilyana's darted around for anything with which to defend herself, when she heard something land with a thud next to her.

"huh?" The mage managed to say as she noticed a large book laying in the middle of the street.

"A spellbook! B-but i've never seen one like this before..."

Noticing the very sharp axe getting closer by the moment, Ilyana decided that it would be best to question this later. She quickly flipped it open, read out an incantation, and watched as the man charging her was suddenly stopped dead in his tracks by a sudden five inch thick layer of ice coating his entire body.

"Well," A figure said from around the corner. "She's gifted with magic, the force that has ruled my land for centuries. This proves that she must be a noble, I'll have to find a time to speak with her later..."

15533211221.content:
After the war everyone was able to find something for them to do. Lara ran an orphanage, Henry worked at that orphanage and was suprisingly good with children. Lon Qu became a potato farmer for reasons no one knew. But today we talk about Morgan.

After the war Morgan realized since there were no more battles Morgan had to find something for him to do. So he experimented with different things piano, (which turned up Morgan was a beast at but that's for another time), juggling, writing books and parkour. 15533212.title: The Dark Mage Tharja

155332121.content:
Things had been looking quite glum for the eccentric young woman, or more so than usual. She had been failing to attract the attention of Robin, the infamous male tactician of the Shepards. When the black haired woman first laid eyes on the man with the mysterious past, she could tell that there was something about him, a certain spark that caused her to go wild whenever he was near.However it seemed that all of her advances were failing. In fact, she had recently seen the tactician blatently flirting with Panne, the sole survivor of the rabbit Taguel species.

"That cursed bunny. I should come up with a hex to make her turn into a tiny bunny rabbit instead of that hulking monster. Ha, I hope you like being extinct." said Tharja under her breath, much to the fear of those around her. The Mage was currently searching for Robin, having lost track of him around an hour back. She had to come up with some new plans. Hexes wouldn't work as she wanted him to fall in love with her naturally. Besides that would make things too easy for the witch.

"Ah Tharja!" Turning around at the sound of her name, Tharja saw that it was Lissa who was calling her. Lissa was the younger sister of Chrom and knew Robin quite well.

'Oh great, another rival. Maybe I should place a hex on her so she'd grow a frog tongue.' thought the sadistic woman as she watched Lissa walk over to her.

"Tharja, do you mind having a little chat? I wanna talk to you about something." said the cleric with her an estatic tone to her words. Letting out a sigh, Tharja agreed and followed the younger girl back to her tent. As the Shepards comprised of a large company of soldiers, tents were a necessary for privacy. As Lissa was often spoiled by Chrome, her tent was double the size of the standard. Entering, Lissa motioned her friend to sit down at the small tea table while Lissa prepared some tea as well. Settling, Lissa tool a sip, letting the fruitful flavore of the particular blend dance around in her mouth. Tharja did the same, mostly to not come off as rude.

"So Tharja, the reason ai brought you here is that I want to help you. I want to help you win Robin's heart!"
155332121.title: Opaque Beginnings

choices: Robin is in his tent, a good oppurnitiy.
Tharja comes across Panne, perhaps a hex is in order?
1553321211.content:
Staring at the energetic girl, Tharja was quite skeptical of her proposal. While she was on speaking terms with the royal girl, she wouldn't exactly describe their relationship as close. Perhaps she had an ulterior motive?

"What is your game. Are you looking to sabotage my efforts with Robin? I'll have you know that I know hexes that could turn you into a newt." said the older woman with malice in her voice.

"What? No, no no. Nothing like that. It's just, I see how much you love him and a know that he deserves someone like that. I mean he has no memory of his past and there's only so much we can all do as friends. Maybe with someone to support him in a different way, he can get better." explained the girl, taking a sip of the freshly made coffee. Tharja reflected on her words, it seemed that she did have a point in how she could help Robin with his memory issues.

"Why me? You said that he would need someone to aid him, what makes you think I would be fit for that?"

"Like I said, I can see something with you two and I just want to help." Propping her arms to rest her head, she knew that she had nothing to lose going along with whatever the younger girl had planned.

"Alright, I'll accept your help. What do you have in mind?" Tilting her head, Lissa didn't really have anything planned. She just figured that Tharja would have all of the bright ideas and she could just act as her lackey. Trying to save face, she quickly came up with a plan.

"Okay, here me out, howabout just talking to him at first. I know that you really just spy on him from away, but maybe you can strike up some conversation, find out his likes and dislikes and move on from there." While simple, this approach seemed like the best thing to do in this situation.

"Very well. While I do prefer sticking to his back, I'll follow what you've said. If things work out well, then I promise not to place hexes on you while you sleep."

"Um, thanks, I guess."
1553321211.title: The First Plan

choices: Steal Panne's stone! Level the playing field!
15533212111.content:
Spying Robin slipping into his tent, Tharja saw the perfect opportunity to talk to him. Following right behind him, she hoped to surprise the tactician, but he was too wise to her games.

"Tharja, what is it... I can tell it's you." Robin sighed, he could tell just by her footsteps

Tharja cuddled up close to Robin, turning him around and putting on a sad face.

"It's just that I haven't seen much of you lately... I've had to look really to hard to sta-... find you at times... is it because you like Panne better than me?" she whimpered, getting as close as humanly possible to him. Robin stalled for a second, but then replied.

"Ah, Tharja, it's our new battle tactic. Panne becomes so big and powerful once she transforms... it's rather remarkable." he replied. "It's astonishing how someone so small can be so large and powerful, we've been working on several new tactics together."

"So if I could do that too, you'd work with me more? I think we'd like that." Tharja joked, hiding her ulterior motives.

"Well...er, yes... but I'm not sure if you can become a Taguel." Robin replied, rather confused with Tharja's response. However, the dark mage knew what she needed to do, she needed to remove Panne's advantage.

"Thank you, Robin... I've got to be off. See you later!"

Leaving a rather confused Robin behind, Tharja hurried to her own tent. Once inside, she began rummaging through her trunk, looking through her tools for something suitable. There were several ways she could go about it, some quicker than others. Gathering the useful tools from her trunk, she took one last look at herself in the mirror.

"Heh, I won't need a body like this once I have Robin..." she laughed. "It was such a chore keeping it like this too."

As long as she had the army's best body in Robin's eyes, nothing else would matter. Preparing for her scheme, she returned to her table, which was now littered with various evil tools.

Choosing between the two potion types, Tharja eventually chose the Increased Appetite potion. From there, the dark mage began to gather the necessary ingredients for such a concoction as this, rummaging through her organized stash of herbal ingredients, both plant ingredients, and one's made up of disembodied pieces of animal parts, from the eyes of newts to the individual scales of a Manakete.

"Let's see if these are the ingredients I need....." Tharja pondered, searching through her memory as to the main ingredients to the potion's recipe were, which included a cow's stomach, the eye of a pig, and half a Manakete scale. After gathering the essential items and brewing them in a cauldron, Tharja glanced at herself in a nearby mirror, looking at her lithe and thin frame for one final time before consuming the potion.

Without hesitation, she then took a long sip from the potion, as the concoction began to take effect on her, causing her stomach let out a loud but hungry growl. Tharja couldn't help but smirk a little out of satisfaction and anticipation toward winning Robin's affections. Heading out to sate her magically enhanced appetite, the dark mage eventually made her way into Ylisse's capital city, Ylisstol, where she fortunately stumbled upon.....
1553321211111.title: Increasing One's Appetite

15533212112.content:
Inside the Tent, Robin and Panne were seen having a private dinner between the two of them, Panne tearing away at carrot stew while Robin merely chattered away to her. As Tharja observed this secretly she began to seethe. That useless Taguel was acting far more interested in eating her food than enjoying Robin's company. The dark mage put Robin before all things, including herself, and felt that others should as well. Feeling annoyance overtake her, she began to mumble.

"That damnable rabbit, she's always stuffing herself, she doesn't see how truly intriguing Robin is." She muttered to herself darkly, a shadow covering her face as her thoughts grew similarly darker. "She's more pig than rabbit, I should hex her to pay for how much extra she eats, pound for pound..."

As Tharja continued to talk to herself, a sinister idea entered her brain. An oversized Panne would soon grow unable to battle, and if she was out of battle, it would give Tharja more time to spend with Robin in the field of battle. If she stuck around and took Lissa's advice, she would be Robin's most likely choice. After all, Tharja had the nicest body in the army, and since Panne ate the most, the curse would affect her with a pound of weight per morsel she consumed. The raven haired hex-caster began to blush at her own genius.

'This plan is utterly foolproof...' She thought to herself as she readied the words within her mind and aimed at Panne. She was lucky the Taguel was dining so intently, otherwise she would have been noticed. As Tharja began to cast her hex, she could feel her black magic's might surge with every word she spoke, affecting Panne's very being. She was about Mid-spell at that moment when...
15533212112.title: Panne's just desserts

choices: Panne wakes up feeling quite strange
155332121122.content:
Tharja hesitated all but for a moment as she recalled that the Taguel women had a hard time digesting certain foods, such as carbs and certain sweets. Focusing with her hex, she concentrated to remove these, to lead to an even greater fattening for the other woman. Feeling the hex's power at max, she stealthy said the incantation and directed it to the overgrown bunny, seeing a clear aura surround Panne and slowly dissipate. Of course, a hex of this caliber would take a few hours to take hold, but Tharja was a patient woman, she would wait a few weeks for Panne to become the obese glutton that she was inside. Quietly leaving the tent, Tharja made way her way back to her own tent to study up on some more hexes in case this one went awry. With Robin and Panne, the tactician was discussing a rather pressing issue he had, but the Taguel had tuned him out ten minutes ago, placing her attention of the delicious food in front of her.

"So, what do you think I should do?" he asked, a confused expression on his face. This was rather rare as the young man almost always had all the right answers. Looking up from her stew, she did recall what he had asked her to the tent for, which was dealing with Tharja.

"Well if you did things like a Taguel, this issue would have been settled ages ago." Robin let out a sigh, Panne was often difficult to deal with at times.

"I'm sorry we all can't be like you Panne."

"As you should be." said the bunny-woman, finishing the last drops of her stew. She presented the empty bowl to Robin and he got up in order to refill it. While she did enjoy the man's cooking, she also enjoyed his company as well. Very few soldiers took interest in her beyond being 'that bunny-lady,' and she greatly enjoyed his friendship. If it wasn't for one issue, she would have taken the tactician as a mate long ago.

"What does he see in that woman anyway?"
---

The next morning, Tharja woke up bright and early like any other day. After the events of the previous day, she was feeling much better and was able to think of many ideas to spend time with her 'precious' Robin. Making her way towards the Mess Hall area, she passed many soldiers, feeling them recoil at her sight. As she was proficient with hexes and had a rather low 'boiling point,' many were quick to get out of her way in fear of being cursed. Reaching the area, a spry blonde haired girl ran up to her.

"Tharja! How'd it go yesterday! C'mon, tell me during breakfast." exclaimed the ever energetic Lissa as she grabbed the dark Mage by the arm and dragged her to get some food.
155332121122.title: Happy Hexes

choices: Keep it a secret.  Experiment on someone else.
1553321211221.content:
"Swimmingly!" Tharja chirped with a happy smile that made Lissa's blood run cold.

"Uh... good!" The healer forced a chuckle. "Lets go over the juicey details over bre..akfast? What's happening over there?"

Soldiers were trickling out of the mess tent, pale-faced and fleeing something. The shouts of "run, run!" And "by Naga she's gunna blow!" Weren't entirely descript enough for Lissa who proposed "Let's go check it out!"

Tharja had a pretty good idea of what to expect, but was still pleasantly surprised by what they found behind the canvas flaps; Panne's backside had long since destroyed her seat at the long table, having ballooned out four feet in every direction. Her tail was like a tiny tuft sitting between two overfilled beanbag chairs. Beanbag chairs Lissa and Tharja noted with respective horror and delight, were still growing.

They both dared to venture around to better examine their ally, Tharja barely able to contain her delight. Panne's belly was naught but a pale dome propping up her massively swollen breasts, which retained a semblence of perkiness through what Tharja could only guess was monstrous internal pressure. Panne's legs were pneumatic cones, and her steadily tightening flabby arms still found some use, stuffing biscuits into her mouth with one hand, and pouring sausage gravy down her throat with the other. Truely a skillful display, not a crumb or drop wasted.

Lissa launched into the standard form reactions; "oh my god, what happened, panne stop, blah blah blah" while Tharja admired her handiwork. She made her way around the side, and out of Lissa's line of sight; which wasn't so hard, given Panne's state. She pinched the Tagul's rear, trailed her fingers along her packed thigh, hefted an overfull breast, and abandoned any pretense of scholarly curiosity as she embraced Panne's tummy and squeezed.

It wasn't love she was feeling. This was something more primal, animal, sinister. She rubbed her cheek against Panne's belly, ground her hips against her tighening flesh, squeezed and massaged the slowly vanishing folds of fat. She contemplated running her tongue over Panne's breast, when a rumble shook her back to the real world.

Panne's entire body was pulsing and throbbing and thrumming with pressure. Tharja could feel the taugul's flesh break out in goose bumps as stretch marks began rapidly spreading over every swollen inch. Tharja remained painfully aroused, but fear got the best of her. She stepped away, and froze. The hex was a mistake. A pound per morsel? That was too far. /no/, that was far enough. It worked flawlessly, Panne was just such a glutton, that this was all her fault! Tharja looked behind her at the table to confirm her passing of the buck; two leftover pots of carrot stew, bones from a picked clean ham shank, and a syrup-smeared platter that had to have once contained the whole camp's supply of flapjacks. Yeah, Panne's fault! This appetite was not part of the hex! Was it?

There was a distinctive chime that made Tharja jump. Lissa's mending staff. Panne was surrounded by a gentle halo of light, the stretch marks receeding. Panne's body still shook and creaked and groaned.

"Lissa! Get out of here! It's too late!" Tharja barked.

"No!" The healer protested. "I can hold her together!" She gripped her staff with both hands, sweat beading on her forehead.

Panne still had a mouthful of food, her cheeks bulging as she chewed. Her expression was abject apathy. Her only reaction to everything around her was to heft her breasts, prod her belly, and pinch her rear. In fact, she seemed awfully pleased with herself. Especially when her inny became an outtie.

"Lissa, she's too far gone! You'll run out of charges first! For Naga's sake, she's still /CHEWING/!"

Lissa squeezed her eyes shut, breathing growing labored, the light at the end of her staff and surrounding Panne began to falter.

"Damnit..." Tharja wrapped herself around Panne's belly, and held on. "Please dont pop please dont pop pleasedontpop pleasedontpop!" She chanted. It was so stupid! She was immediately kicking herself! Cover, find cover! But she didn't. She ignored every selfish instict for this futile effort. Panne swallowed.

CRACK!

Lissa's staff snapped, and she fell to her knees. Tharja raised her hand, and threw Lissa from the room with a hasty spell.

Panne's belly groaned, the stretch marks coloring her body an angry red. She finally spoke; "I'm fu-"

BOOM!

As Tharja spiralled through the air, she noted a strange taste, like strawberries, and how the world around her was suddenly pink. Then her head smashed into the central post and everything went black.

---

"Robin... Robin... feed me, Robin..." Tharja muttered weakly from the gutter, thin as a rail, and trembling like a leaf.

"Robin! Robin! Feed me!" Echoed all of the women from the camp in unison, each one fatter than a house, and bursting at the seams. Robin stood, surrounded, armed with only a tray of cake. One by one he gleefully stuffed a slice in their mouthes. Sumia, Cordellia, Mirabell, Olivia, Lucina, Murial, Sully, Nowi, and lastly Panne all chewed, swallowed, moaned orgasmically, and burst into confetti.

A tear rolled down Tharja's boney cheek as she was left to waste away...

Then she woke up.

"Whoa, easy there!" Robin's voice shocked her, she moved to recoil, but the sharp pain in her shoulder gave her the new priority of yelping.

"Easy now... Mirabell fixed up your head with her staff, but her and Lissa had to go into town for some more supplies. Your shoulder was in bad shape, you've got a sling on."

"So I do..." she also noticed she was wearing a massive white tunic and not much else under the covers. "Is this... your shirt?"

Robin shook his head. "No, you were coated in pink goo. Your outfit's being cleaned. We just found that one hanging around."

"You're welcome," Kellem mumbled, not that anyone noticed.

"Oh... well..." unused to being alone with, much less face to face with the Tactician, Tharja had to pause to collect your thoughts. "So... why are you here again?"

Robin smiled. That dumb goofy smile that on anyone else would drive Tharja mad, but in this case, drove her wild. "I volunteered to take care of you. Lissa said how you daved her, and tried to save Panne," Tharja felt a pang of regret, "...her theory is some new weapon or spell from our enemies. Lucina never saw anything like this in her time, and Muriel's stumped too!" By Grima Robin seemed almost excited. Tharja knew better than to take his giddiness as a lack of care or remorse. He wanted to solve this puzzle, find a counter, and make the enemy pay gor taking his friend. But for now Tharja took pleasure in imagining a true sociopathic glee.

"...so I volunteered to play nursemaid for you so we could go over ideas!"

Tharja's pale skin flushed red, as so many healer/patient fantasies flashed through her head. But one stuck out the most: Robin feeding her, stuffing her with more and more and more until she couldn't hold another bite and then yet even more, then bursting all over him like his massive love-balloon!

She shook that out of mind. "Yeah, sure, but right now I'm hungry. Could you feed me?" She fluttered her eyelashes, shifting to the side to display her broken arm with a pitiful pout.

(I do not wish to include any spoilers, but to avoid the editing or disregard for this chapter, I want to point out that I have a twist in mind regarding Panne's fate.)

15533212222222221112122.content:
Themis. Home to one of the most influential noble houses in Ylisse, Themis was also the home of Maribelle, the biological daughter of the former Duke of Themis. Ever since the events that led up to her father being put up on trial and losing his rank as the Duke of Themis, Maribelle took up the title as the Duchess of Themis, as well as being a magistrate from time to time.

However, as for her fellow comrades, Maribelle still retains a good relationship with some of her fellow Shepherds, including her fellow Noblewoman and best friend Lissa, who had shared what she discovered outside of Ylisse with brother Chrom. But even though the war with Grima has ended, there was still one thing, or rather, one person that Maribelle kept thinking about for the past few weeks; the female tactician known only as Robin.

In the beginning when she was first introduced to Robin, Maribelle was barely interested in the silver-haired woman, especially when the blonde Noblewoman was appalled by the apparent lack of manners when praising Vaike's burping. But slowly over time however, Maribelle became intrigued about the Shepherds' amnesiac of a brilliant strategist, right up to the point where she couldn't stop thinking about Robin.

Unfortunately, she came across a problematic situation; Maribelle didn't know what Robin actually likes! She wasn't sure if Robin was into dating men or women, and she wasn't sure what sort of preferences Robin has. So, in order to counteract this conundrum, Maribelle decided to....
15533212222222221112122.title: Thinking About Robin

choices: "...Robin's actually into fat women. That's all I found out."

155332122222222211121221.content:
Around a week ago, Maribelle hired the 'thief with a sweet tooth' known as Gaius to spy on Robin, who was still in Ylisse's capital city, Ylisstol, being Chrom's advisor in both politics and military tactics. When Gaius met with the newly appointed duchess, he still called Maribelle by the nickname "Twinkles", due to the blonde Noblewoman's mannerisms.

However, despite the awkward nickname, Maribelle tried her best to ignore what Gaius called her by and got down to business with the candy-craving thief, explaining what she wanted him to do and why. But in exchange of his services, Maribelle would give him both a good sum of money and a large bag of candy.

Knowing Gaius and his unusual habits, the thief did what was asked of him in exchange for the sugar-induced sweets. However, a full week has passed, as Maribelle almost impatiently for Gaius to arrive with the information at hand, sitting on the Themis throne while twirling one of her long blonde curls with her finger out of boredom.

But finally, after waiting for half a day, Gaius had returned, as he stealthily made it to the Throne Room where Maribelle was waiting in, then walked up behind her and said, "Missed me, Twinkles?" This quickly caught Maribelle by complete surprise, causing her to jump and quickly turn around to face the candy-loving thief and said, "How dare you sneak up on me like that, Gaius!"

"Sorry, it's a force of habit for us thieves, Twinkles. Anyway, I got the 'info' you wanted on Robin, it's not like I can forget what she looks like." Gaius replied, ready to put up with his end of the bargain, just so he can get that child-sized bag of candy. In a response of slight doubt, Maribelle crossed her pink gloved arms and asked, "Hmph, how do I know that you're not lying to me? After all, you're a thief, are you not?"

Gaius could somewhat understand Maribelle's doubt. After all, being a practiced liar is one of those requirements needed to be a thief, besides being sneaky and knowing how to lockpick a door or chest open. So, Gaius looked at the blonde Noblewoman and answered, "It is true that stealing things is part of my profession. But when the job I was hired for having the reward being a large bag of candy, consider me sold, Twinkles. You sure you still want the info on her?"

Knowing his obsession with candy, Maribelle lowered her guard some and said, "~sigh~ Yes, that is the reason why I hired you in the first place to begin with, Gaius. Now, what have you learned from spying on the famed tactician?" "Uh uh uh, first you give me the candy, Twinkles, and then you get your info." Gaius replied, tempting Maribelle to hand over the bag of candy first before revealing what he knew from spying on Robin.

Needing the information gathered on Robin, Maribelle let out a disgruntled sigh, as she snapped the fingers on her right hand once, prompting 2 butlers to haul in the bag of candy into the Throne Room. Judging from how the butlers were carrying it, the candy bag must have weighed over 50 to 60 pounds, which grabbed Gaius's attention.

However, before he could go after his reward, Maribelle stopped him and said, "First, the information, then your compensation, Gaius." Figuring that Maribelle was being very persistent about what he found out on Robin, Gaius mumbled a bit and replied, "Fine. If you want it that badly Twinkles, I'll tell. Turns out...."
155332122222222211121221.title: Spying On Robin

"I'm telling the truth, Twinkles, I swear! I did what you hired me to do, kept my distance to avoid being spotted by her. Satisfied with the reward, Gaius slung the bag of candy over his back and left Castle Themis, leaving Maribelle with the recieved information he gave to her, wondering what the Noblewoman was going to do next.

155332122222222211121221112.content:
Although she was known to be a rather heavyset woman, Maribelle fondly remembered her mother to be quite the compassionate and kind individual. Along with the compassionate personality, Maribelle's mother was well-known throughout the Kingdom of Ylisse as an adept seamstress, masterfully crafting and sowing dresses, gowns, and other articles of clothing for women of all sizes, ranging from frail and petite, to rotund and obese.

And yet, here stood Maribelle, completely lost as to what she should do, as she began to speak to the portrait of her late mother like she was still alive and said, "*Sigh*....Mother, I.... have a confession to make. I'm.....I'm in love with another woman. I know that you might be surprised at this, but.....you see, she's.....she's into, um..... women of *gulp* larger physiques. To be honest....I'm not sure on my decision as of yet. Should I simply follow my heart and lose my petite figure to satisfy Robin's desires, or.....o-or should I just submit my love for her and move on with my life. Tell me, mother.....What should I do?"

Silence was all she heard, as Maribelle let out a depressed sigh, but just as she was about to walk away, she heard a subtle motherly voice inside her head that simply replied, "....Follow....what your heart...truly desires, my beloved.....Maribelle....." From there, Maribelle quickly turned around to face her mother's portrait once more, almost as if her mother's spirit was contacting her from beyond the grave, giving her some maternal advice for her beloved daughter.

Seeing this as a possible sign of her mother's acceptance, Maribelle took those words to heart and decided to follow her heart's desires: Win Robin's affections. However, she was aware that in order to accomplish such a feat.....she would have to gain weight. A LOT of weight, in fact. So, in order to complete such a feat, Maribelle decided to......

1553321222222222111212211121.content:
After deliberately contemplating on how she should proceed, Maribelle eventually concluded on what she should do and said, "Hmm.....Sweets do happen to let an individual gain weight, so.....maybe I should consume lots of sweets instead." From there, she nodded in self-confirmation, intent on packing on the pounds to attract Robin. Upon making her decision, Maribelle then ordered her maids to deliver a large amount of dessert and a few other delectable cuisines.

Although, she knew that simply stuffing herself with sweets was not going to be a cakewalk (no pun intended), but she had to try at least. Once the maids delivered a large, fresh-from-the-oven multi-layered chocolate cake covered in vanilla and strawberry frosting, Maribelle began to consume the mouth-watering dessert, whilst still performing the necessary table manners in the process, digging her knife and fork into the calorie-filled cuisine.

Of course, due to no prior physical experience with binging, Maribelle's became quite stuffed fairly easily, consuming only a meager 1/3rd of the large cake. Sure it wasn't what she had expected, but it was a start. However, she knew she had quite a long way to go before she could easily devour an entire cake in one sitting. So, in an effort to reach her bed to digest the pieces of cake inside her stomach, Maribelle attempted to stand up on her own, but struggled due to her bloated abdomen stuffed to brim with chocolate and cake.

Fortunately for the young noblewoman, her two maids were willing to give their lady a plentiful amount of assistance, escorting the stuffed Maribelle to her bedroom, which was a daunting task in her current physical state. While another group of maids transported the cake remains to preserve it for a later time, Maribelle and the two maids finally reached their destination: Maribelle's bedroom, as the young noblewoman was gently laid out onto her queen-sized bed to rest her body, along with aiding in her stomach's digestion process.

155332221221111.content:
"No, I'm fine Corrin." Rinkah said in a sullen tone.

Corrin, as many know, is both a prince of Nohr and Hoshido but has given up both titles in the hope that he can end the war without destroying either side.

He and Rinkah have a rather odd relationship with each other. The first time they met was when King Garon was having her executed and Corrin saved her, and then they met again when Rinkah saved him from the wind tribe. Corrin has also managed to break Rinkah of her aloof disposition and in turn she has become more friendly with the rest of Corrin's allies, however Rinkah still feels rather uncomfortable around Corrin.

"Here, let me help you up." Corrin said as he held out his hand.

"Thanks, Corrin, but I can handle myself." Rinkah said as she pushed his hand away.

"Rinkah, it looks like you fought an entire army. You can tell me if there's something's wrong.

"No! There's nothing wrong!"

"Listen, Rinkah, you've been running yourself ragged lately and it's starting to affect you in the field. You've been so worn out that in our last battle, the enemies were walking straight past you without you noticing."

Rinkah suddenly froze in shock.

"What! No that's not true!"

"I'm sorry for being the bearer of bad news, but it is true." Corrin said as he braced for an angry response from Rinkah, but instead she just sat back on the ground looking depressed.

"I'm at a loss for what to do. If I keep training like this I'll be less effective in battle, but if I don't keep up the training I won't be able to get stronger." Rinkah thought to herself.

"I'm sorry for upsetting you, Rinkah, I just wanted to help you." Corrin said sadly.

"I'll just go..."

"I...I want to get stronger." Rinkah muttered under her breath.

"What?"

"I said I want to get stronger!"

Corrin stood in silence, unsure of what to say.

"You may think it's childish, but I want to become the strongest women in the army. I've been trying to surpass Effie, but no matter how hard I try I can never surpass her incredible strength."

This is the first time Corrin has ever seen Rinkah so vulnerable, she's usually so independent. As Corrin kept thinking to himself he eventually got an idea.

"Hey, Rinkah, come with me. I think I might know something that can help." Corrin said hoping that this would help his brawny friend.

"Really?" Rinkah asked hopefully

"I'm positive it'll help, now let's go." Corrin said smiling and holding his hand out to Rinkah again.

She keeps shoving more candies in her mouth, too overcome with they're amazing flavor to do anything else, her toned abs giving way to a tight growing globe that is her belly.

155332221221122.content:
Corrin sat quietly on the edge of his bed as he awaited for the requested person to arrive and knock on his door.

He had requested her presence a while ago, but he was willing to offer patience for her sake and withhold any complaints. After all, he knew how long it could take someone, especially a with her proportions, to reach his bedroom at times. A number of other reasons would explain away the lateness, but none of them would have been able to apply here tonight. Corrin checked the pocket watch he kept so dutifully close to him. The one that Corrin wished to see was going to be his betrothed, the woman he would soon marry officially before the royal courts themselves.

Their rendezvous in his personal chambers was relegated to briefness. Corrin wanted the chance to see her before he would be forced to return to his regal duties, where he would continue his supervision over writing out the peace treaties between the formerly-warring kingdoms of Hoshido and Nohr. Even though that was far more important, he still wanted to waste a few moments with his wife-to-be. He had his own needs to attend to as any other human would have. He was not going to ever claim he was above such things, just because he possessed royal status.

A few moments later and Corrin watched the door open, which prompted him to straighten his posture out of habit.

Rinkah was a former "savage" of the Fire Tribe, an Oni woman who had come to join the Hoshido side to help protect her people from the invading Nohr armies. However, over the course of the war, Corrin had fallen in love with her raw power and endearing personality, which ultimately resulted in him asking for her hand in marriage. Rinkah had many reasons to accept, one of them being her own growing affection for the young prince, so she voluntarily agreed to his proposal. But when the peacetime began, the Oni moved in with her lover at his castle home. Surrounded by opulence of the likes she'd never known before, Rinkah was initially overwhelmed. This was a world that was leagues above anything she could have imagined, the world of the wealthy and powerful. Although she never quite took to having to wear all of those fancy dresses or attending conferences, the delicious food on the other hand, was something she welcomed with open arms.

In fact, over the past several months, Rinkah's eating habits had done a heavy number on her body. What was once firm and lean on her body had gradually turned fleshy and bulbous. Abs dissolved as her stomach lurched further and further out in front of her, the skin around her abdomen becoming stretched and tender as a result. Even the bulging muscles that once coated her arms and legs, granting her the strength to lift the maces she wielded so high, were now gone. Nowadays, they had all sank and drowned underneath the sea of blubber cascading over her. Dimples, creases, rolls, and folds were in abundance; every time Corrin saw her, there seemed to be another few on her somewhere. Although her clothes were currently tailored to fit her increased widith, the struggle between Rinkah's bodily girth and her clothes was still undeniable every day. Her shirt had gotten caught underneath her enlarged breasts, leaving her whole big belly hanging out. Hard to believe that one woman could let herself go so badly when she had a pedigree like hers. And yet somehow (and maybe with a little encouragement on the side from Corrin), Rinkah had done it.
155332221221122.title: Rinkah, The Chubby Oni

15533222122221.content:
Hmm, so you decided to go with Camilla, huh? Well, why not. Now then, here are a few story ideas that can work well as to how the buxom Camilla packed on the pounds.

Story 1: Sumo-Sized Camilla

Following her marriage to King Ryoma after the war between Noir and Hoshido had ended, the marital union between the beloved Hoshido ruler and a member of the Nohrian Royal Family was considered highly controversial by most, even blasphemous by some. However, in an attempt to rid herself of such animosity from her citizens, Camilla made a point of learning Hoshidan culture and ingratiating herself to her newfound subject.

At first, she had little success. But one day, she soon discovered the perfect way to gain the respect and adoration of Hoshido's citizens, which came in the form of a rather intriguing sport that nowadays was mostly obscure to Hoshidans:

Sumo Wrestling.

But when she had decided that her next project will be to put Sumo Wrestling back on the map, Camilla found herself to be rocking the world...and in more days than one.

Story 2: Too Much Pampering

With the war finally over, Camilla could finally relax and indulge. However, when she indulges too much, she'll soon be finding herself some bigger britches.

Anyway, which story will you choose?
